taskDescription: The Etruscan shrew is one of the worldâ€™s smallest mammals. It has a huge appetite, eating almost twice its weight in food each day. Its heart beats at a rate of 25 beats per second! Which of the following is a reasonable value for the weight of an Etruscan shrew: 2 g, 2 kg, or 2 mt? Explain your answer.
detailedSolution: A reasonable value for the weight of an Etruscan shrew is 2 g. A 2 L bottle of water weighs 2 kg, and since it is one of the smallest mammals, the shrew must weigh less than that, so 2 g seems reasonable.
